alert.note: Alert for Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 9:47PM EDT until July 28 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT/MIDNIGHT CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northern Indiana, including the following counties, in north central Indiana, Kosciusko. In northern Indiana, Fulton IN, Marshall, Miami, Pulaski and Starke. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT /1 AM EDT/midnight CDT/ Saturday/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 PM EDT /846 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rochester, Knox, Argos, Culver, Akron, Mentone, Mexico, Walnut, Tippecanoe, Oak Grove, Kewanna, Erie, Denver, Fulton, Monterey, Macy, Burket, Tiosa, Leiters Ford and Lake Manitou. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
